Operation 'getAssets' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is incomplete and vague. data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset in the system
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve fixed assets with filtering and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of fixed assets from the system. Supports filtering by asset status and other criteria through query parameters. Returns an Assets object containing asset records and pagination information. Use this operation to search for and retrieve multiple assets based on specified search criteria.
data.reasoning: Original summary is incomplete and vague. Description lacks clarity about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. Added specifics about pagination support, filtering options, return type (Assets object), and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Adds an asset to the system
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fixed asset in the system. Accepts an Asset object in the request body containing asset details such as asset name, asset type, purchase date, and depreciation settings. Returns the created Asset object with assigned asset ID and current valuation. The asset is immediately available for depreciation calculations and reporting.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is too minimal. Missing details about request body structure, what fields are expected, what the response contains, and side effects (asset becomes available for depreciation). Enhanced description provides clarity on inputs, outputs, and operational effects for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
By passing in the appropriate asset id, you can search for
a specific fixed asset in the system
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific fixed asset by its unique identifier. Requires the asset ID as a path parameter. Use this operation to fetch detailed information about a particular asset.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description is vague and lacks detail about what is returned. data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset types in the system
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all available fixed asset types configured in the system. Asset types define the depreciation methods, useful life, and other accounting properties for assets. Returns an array of AssetType objects. Use this operation to discover valid asset types before creating new assets.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about the action. Description lacks specificity about what asset types are, what they contain, and their purpose. Improved summary uses clearer action verb. Enhanced description explains the domain concept of asset types, their role in asset creation, and return structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Adds an fixed asset type to the system
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fixed asset type in the system. Accepts an AssetType object containing type name, depreciation method, useful life, and other accounting properties. Returns the created AssetType object with assigned type ID. The new asset type becomes immediately available for use when creating new assets.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is minimal. Missing details about request structure, what properties define an asset type, response content, and availability after creation. message: Operation 'getAssetSettings' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, inconsistent_terminology, missing_output_details. Summary uses vague 'searches' terminology. Description incorrectly mentions 'asset types' instead of 'settings' - inconsistent with operation purpose. Missing clarity on what settings are returned and their purpose. Improved summary uses clearer action verb. Enhanced description distinguishes settings from types, explains their scope (organization-wide), and clarifies return structure and use cases.

data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset types in the system
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the global fixed asset accounting settings configured for the organization. Settings include book depreciation configurations, asset numbering schemes, and other organization-wide asset management preferences. Returns a Setting object containing all active asset settings. Use this operation to understand the organization's asset accounting policies before creating or modifying assets.
data.reasoning: Summary uses vague 'searches' terminology. Description incorrectly mentions 'asset types' instead of 'settings' - inconsistent with operation purpose. Missing clarity on what settings are returned and their purpose. Improved summary uses clearer action verb. Enhanced description distinguishes settings from types, explains their scope (organization-wide), and clarifies return structure and use cases.

data.current_description: Adds an fixed asset type to the system
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fixed asset type in the system. Accepts an AssetType object containing type name, depreciation method, useful life, and other accounting parameters. Returns the created AssetType object with assigned type ID. The new asset type becomes immediately available for use when creating new assets and affects how future assets of this type are depreciated.
